  • Method Details

    • setLocalizedMessageFileName

      public static void setLocalizedMessageFileName(String qualifiedPackagePath)
      Set location and name of resource file containing localized messages

      Use '<package_path>.messages' if 'messages_<locale>.properties' files exist in package <package_path>.

      Parameters:
      qualifiedPackagePath - fully qualified base name of localized message file (e.g. 'de.icx.v4j.app.xxx.i18n.messages')

    • getBundleForLocale

      Get resource bundle for locale (for localized text messages)
      Parameters:
      locale - locale for localization
      Returns:
      resource bundle for given locale

    • i18n

      public static String i18n(ResourceBundle bundle, String key)
      Get localized message by given resource bundle
      Parameters:
      bundle - resource bundle (got from ResourceBundle.getBundle(message file name, locale))
      key - text to get localized message for
      Returns:
      localized message if configured, key otherwise

      localized message if configured, key otherwise

    • findJavaResourceFiles

      public static List<File> findJavaResourceFiles(String fileName) throws IOException
      Find all (resource) files with given path/name in Java class path.

      Resource file(s) must be situated exactly under given path/name in one of the possibly multiple class path root entries (e.g.: class path: <TOMCAT>/lib,<WEB-INF>/classes and search for log4j.properties: where log4j.properties is directly under <TOMCAT>/lib and under <WEB-INF>/classes/de/common - than it will be found only in <TOMCAT>/lib).

      Do not find files in jars!

      Parameters:
      fileName - resource file name - can be preceded by path relative to one of the class path root entries
      Returns:
      List of resource files of given name
      Throws:
      IOException - on IO error

    • findFirstJavaResourceFile

      public static File findFirstJavaResourceFile(String fileName) throws IOException
      Find first (resource) file with given path/name in Java class path.

      Behaves like findJavaResourceFiles(String) but returns only first file found.

      Parameters:
      fileName - resource file name - can be preceded by path relative to one of the class path root entries
      Returns:
      first resource files of given name found or null
      Throws:
      IOException - on IO error
